>@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.Item.On2ZrPJTe8FURsXY]{Operative Exploit}

You can use a small arm to make a melee attack. Treat this as an attack using @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.feats.Item.B45QyyepcPHcjYtr]{Improved Unarmed Strike} (whether or not you have that feat), but the attack is not @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.Nrf6oy9pJwcEmryP.JournalEntryPage.nXkFsyxk7Vybdn7G#archaic]{Archaic}, deals lethal damage, and has the @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.Nrf6oy9pJwcEmryP.JournalEntryPage.nXkFsyxk7Vybdn7G#operative]{Operative} weapon special property. If you have an ability that gives you a special version of @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.feats.Item.9Us7Eg9cAoq3BcS5]{Weapon Specialization} that allows you to add 1-1/2 Ã— your level to natural or unarmed attacks as damage (such as vesk @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.racial-features.Item.KfEzPksDco3HYSjz]{Natural Weapons}), you add your level to pistol whip unarmed strikes; otherwise you add half your level as normal for an operative weapon. When you make an unarmed attack, you must decide before making the attack roll whether you are making a normal unarmed attack or using pistol whip to attack with a small arm.
